Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Developing a mindful “practice” is exactly that. For very good reasons it is not called developing a mindful “ instant result.”*

Author: Mitch Albom*
Quote: All endings are also beginnings. We just don’t know it at the time.*

Author: Joanne Raptis*
Quote: Be like a tree. Stay grounded. Connect with your roots. Turn over a new leaf. Bend before you break. Enjoy your unique natural beauty. Keep growing.*

Author: Eckhart Tolle*
Quote: The greater part of human pain is unnecessary. It is self-created as long as the unobserved mind runs your life.*

Author: Dalai Lama*
Quote: We are so accustomed to faulty states of mind that it is difficult to change with just a little practice. Just a drop of something sweet cannot change a taste that is powerfully bitter. We must persist in the face of failure.*

Author: Elbert Hubbard*
Quote: Men are only as great as they are kind.*

Author: Byron Katie*
Quote: Taking responsibility for your beliefs and judgements gives you the power to change them.*

Author: Hafiz of Shiraz*
Quote: I wish I could show you, when you are lonely or in darkness, the astonishing light of your own being.*

Author: Dodinsky*
Quote: The key to being happy is knowing you have the power to choose what to accept and what to let go.*

Author: Frank A. Clark*
Quote: Real generosity is doing something nice for someone who will never find out.*

Author: Channing Pollock*
Quote: Happiness is a way station between too little and too much.*

Author: E.E. Cummings*
Quote: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.*

Author: Atul Purohit*
Quote: Life is about trusting your feelings and taking chances, losing and finding happiness, appreciating the memories, learning from the past, and realizing people change.*

Author: Benjamin Franklin*
Quote: When you’re finished changing, you’re finished.*

Author: Natalie Babbitt*
Quote: Don’t be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don’t have to live forever; you just have to live.*

Author: KT Witten*
Quote: Your dream doesn’t have an expiration date. Take a deep breath and try again.*

Author: Rosalyn S. Yalow*
Quote: The excitement of learning separates youth from old age. As long as you’re learning you’re not old.*

Author: Viktor E. Frankl*
Quote: For the meaning of life differs from man to man, from day to day and from hour to hour. What matters, therefore, is not the meaning of life in general but rather the specific meaning of a person's life at a given moment.*

Author: Viktor E. Frankl*
Quote: Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response. In our response lies our growth and our freedom.*

Author: Chinese Proverb*
Quote: People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.*

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche*
Quote: To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.*

Author: Daisaku Ikeda*
Quote: The person who lives life fully, glowing with life’s energy, is the person who lives a successful life.*

Author: Joseph Campbell*
Quote: I don’t believe people are looking for the meaning of life as much as they are looking for the experience of being alive.*

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche*
Quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.*

Author: Steven Pinker*
Quote: Morality is not just any old topic in psychology but close to our conception of the meaning of life. Moral goodness is what gives each of us the sense that we are worthy human beings.*

Author: Mitch Albom*
Quote: The way you get meaning into your life is to devote yourself to loving others, devote yourself to your community around you, and devote yourself to creating something that gives you purpose and meaning.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: There are times it feels like a struggle to bring a sense of meaning and purpose to our lives. Don’t give up hope. When we choose to look for it we can find meaning and purpose in the simplest of tasks.*

Author: Mahatma Gandhi*
Quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.*

Author: Wayne Dyer*
Quote: You get World Peace through Inner Peace. If you've got a world full of people who have Inner Peace, then you have a Peaceful World.*

Author: Carl Rogers*
Quote: The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am, then I can change.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Trust is not a gift to others.It is a gift to ourselves.  The one who trusts themselves and others sleeps peacefully.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Not trusting someone does not miraculously make them more trustworthy. It just makes you hyper vigilant, stressed and grumpy. Your choice.*

Author: Erica Layne*
Quote: Balance isn’t fitting everything in. It's starting with what’s important and letting the rest fall as it will.*

Author: Danielle Orner*
Quote: Life is a balance between what we can control and what we cannot. I am learning to live between effort and surrender.*

Author: Thich Nhat Hanh*
Quote: In true dialogue, both sides are willing to change.*

Author: Kahlil Gibran*
Quote: Our anxiety does not come from thinking about the future, but from wanting to control it.*

Author: Glenn Turner*
Quote: Worrying is like a rocking chair, it gives you something to do, but it gets you nowhere.*

Author: Joyce Meyer*
Quote: Worry is a downpayment on a problem you may never have.*

Author: Dalai Lam*
Quote: There are only two days in the year that nothing can be done. One is called yesterday and the other is called tomorrow, so today is the right day to love, believe, do, and mostly, love.*

Author: Mark Twain*
Quote: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.*

Author: Rachel Wolchin*
Quote: Maturity is realizing how many things don’t require your comment.*

Author: Eunice Camacho Infante*
Quote: In the end, people will judge you anyway. So don’t live your life impressing others. Live your life impressing yourself.*

Author: Byron Katie*
Quote: When you argue with reality, you lose, but only 100% of the time.*

Author: Bryant McGill*
Quote: Your calm mind is the ultimate weapon against your challenges. So Relax.*

Author: Matt Kahn*
Quote: Despite how open, peaceful, and loving you attempt to be, people can only meet you as deeply as they have met themselves.*

Author: Seneca*
Quote: You are your choices.*

Author: Cheryl Strayed*
Quote: You don’t have a right to the cards you think you should have been dealt. You have an obligation to play the hell out of the ones you’re holding.*

Author: Eckhart Tolle*
Quote: On a deeper level you are already complete. When you realize that, there is a playful, joyous energy behind what you do.*

Author: Marcu Aurelius*
Quote: People look for retreats for themselves, in the country, by the coast, or in the hills . . . There is nowhere that a person can find a more peaceful and trouble-free retreat than in his own mind. . . . So constantly give yourself this retreat, and renew yourself.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Our ability to take two separate pieces of information, intuitively draw a connection between them and then commit to that as if it were a fact is quite amazing. It is also a major source of conflict, both internal and external, for many people.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Change is part of our lives. It is best dealt with continually. Little and often. Leave it too long and just like tectonic plates the energy released and the difficulty dealing with it is more intense. We know this intuitively yet many of us act in the opposite way.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Your physical & emotional signs of stress are a sign that you are not dealing with feelings of vulnerability. It’s ok to feel vulnerable. It’s also healthy to notice and take action.*

Author: Eckhart Tolle*
Quote: When you become comfortable with uncertainty, infinite possibilities open up in your life.*

Author: Eckhart Tolle*
Quote: Worry means the mind is controlling you. Worry is always pointless. A solution never comes out of worry.*

Author: Carl Rogers*
Quote: The only person who cannot be helped is that person who blames others.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: If you can judge them for it you are capable of the same. Just because you choose not to behave that way does not make you better than them. Judgement blocks empathy every time.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Don’t look to be completed by love, as if there is some part of you missing. Love’s job is to compliment someone who is already good enough.*

Author: Daisaku Ikeda*
Quote: Genuine sincerity opens people's hearts, while manipulation causes them to close.*

Author: Byron Katie*
Quote: A thought is harmless unless we believe it. It’s not our thoughts, but our attachment to our thoughts, that causes suffering. Attaching to a thought means believing that it’s true, without inquiring. A belief is a thought that we’ve been attaching to, often for years.*

Author: Walter Anderson*
Quote: Our lives only improve when we take chances and the first and most difficult risk we can take is to be honest with ourselves.*

Author: Paulo Coelho*
Quote: How people treat other people is a direct reflection of how they feel about themselves.*

Author: Caroline Myss*
Quote: When you do not seek or need approval, you are at your most powerful.*

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe*
Quote: The way you see people is the way you treat them, and the way you treat them is what they become.*

Author: Steve Furtick *
Quote: The reason we struggle with insecurity is because we compare our behind-the-scenes with everyone else’s highlight reel.*

Author: Mandy Hale*
Quote: You will never gain anyone’s approval by begging for it. When you stand confident in your own worth, respect follows.*

Author: Idil Ahmed*
Quote: Don’t personalize or internalize other people’s behaviour. What they do is not a reflection of you. Their actions represent them and where they are in their growth. Just observe instead of getting caught up and overreacting emotionally.*

Author: Byron Katie*
Quote: It’s not your job to like me - It’s mine.*

Author: Pema Chodron *
Quote: Without giving up hope  -  that there's somewhere better to be, that there’s someone better to be -  we will never relax with where we are or who we are.*

Author: Cheng Yen*
Quote: Happiness does not come from having much, but from being attached to little.*

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt*
Quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.*

Author: Daniell Koepke*
Quote: The truth is that the way other people see us isn’t about us - it’s about them and their own struggles, insecurities, and limitations.You don’t have to allow their judgement to become your truth.*

Author: Michael Josephson*
Quote: When someone is nasty or treats you poorly, don’t take it personally. It says nothing about you but a lot about them.*

Author: Zen Shin*
Quote: A flower does not think of competing with the flower next to it. It just blooms.*

Author: Wilson Kanadi*
Quote: Those who judge will never understand, and those who understand will never judge.*

Author: Mandy Hale*
Quote: If you don’t love yourself, you’ll always be chasing after people who don’t love you either.*

Author: Tony A Gaskins Jnr*
Quote: You teach people how to treat you by what you allow, what you stop, and what you reinforce.*

Author: George Bernard Shaw*
Quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: By learning to like myself more I make myself immune to the pain I cause myself when I imagine others may not feel the same.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Affirming to myself that “I am enough” every day is important. It is vital that I am the one I get this message from. Receiving it from others can lead to disbelief at best, over dependence on others and self rejection at worst.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Self Esteem...the clue is in the first word. Don't make it other’s responsibility to make or break yours.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Those behaviours we criticise in others are the parts of us we seek to suppress. Try being more accepting of yourself it allows you to be a nicer person.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: The more needy you are, the more opportunity you give yourself to experience others as not meeting your needs. It’s the ultimate self fulfilling victim prophecy.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: The challenge many of us have in today’s world is that we rely too much on other people’s validation for our source of happiness. The person with the greatest influence over your happiness is you.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: When you can take responsibility for liking, listening and respecting yourself you let others off the hook of unrealistic expectations and can enjoy healthy adult to adult relationships with them.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Have you noticed when you are not feeling good about yourself you are more judgemental of others? Give yourself a break and those around you.*

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt*
Quote: I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.*

Author: Byron Katie*
Quote: Spare yourself from seeking love, approval, or appreciation-from anyone. And watch what happens in reality, just for fun.*

Author: Debbie Ford*
Quote: By choosing not to allow parts of ourselves to exist, we are forced to expend huge amounts of psychic energy to keep them beneath the surface.*

Author: Debbie Ford*
Quote: The greatest act of courage is to be and to ownall of who you are without apology, without excuses, without masks to cover the truth of who you are.*

Author: Rhonda Byrne*
Quote: Treat yourself with love and respect, and you will attract people who show you love and respect.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: When I experience myself as not OK...it is not OK!!...I don’t like it. So don’t tell me it is OK. However, as I start to realise it is a normal part of the human experience to feel this way...in other words I am normal...that helps.*

Author: Laurence J. Peter*
Quote: Speak when you are angry and you’ll make the best speech you’ll ever regret.*

Author: Brené Brown*
Quote: Embracing our vulnerabilities is risky but not nearly as dangerous as giving up on love and belonging and joy—the experiences that make us the most vulnerable.*

Author: Kimberley Jones*
Quote: Don’t let people pull you into their storm. Pull them into your peace.*

Author: Jenni Young*
Quote: Every situation in life is temporary. So, when life is good, make sure you enjoy and receive it fully. And when life is not so good, remember that it will not last forever and better days are on the way.*

Author: Fred Rogers*
Quote: When we can talk about our feelings, they become less overwhelming, less upsetting and less scary.*

Author: Brene Brown*
Quote: If you trade your authenticity for safety, you may experience the following; anxiety, depression, eating disorders, addiction, rage, blame, resentment and inexplicable grief.*

Author: Marcus Aurelius*
Quote: The happiness of your life depends on the quality of your thoughts.*

Author: Don Miguel Ruiz*
Quote: Just imagine becoming the way you used to be as a very young child, before you understood the meaning of any word, before opinions took over your mind. The real you is loving, joyful, and free. The real you is just like a flower, just like the wind, just like the ocean, just like the sun.*

Author: Jack Kornfield*
Quote: Like a sandcastle, all is temporary. Build it, tend it, enjoy it. And when the time comes, let it go.*

Author: Donald Miller*
Quote: When you stop expecting people to be perfect, you can like them for who they are.*

Author: Cherie Carter-Scott*
Quote: Anger makes you smaller, while forgiveness forces you to grow beyond what you are.*

Author: Alain de Botton*
Quote: The largest part of what we call “personality” is determined by how we have opted to defend ourselves against anxiety and sadness.*

Author: William Arthur Ward*
Quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems; not people. To focus your energies on answers; not excuses.*

Author: Byron Katie*
Quote: Since the beginning of time people have been trying to change the world so that they can be happy. This hasn’t ever worked, because it approaches the problem backward.*

Author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb*
Quote: My mood, my sadness,my bouts of anxiety are a second source of intelligence - perhaps even the first source.*

Author: Jaeda DeWalt*
Quote: My Life isn’t good or bad. It’s an incredible series of emotional and mental extremes, with beautiful thunderstorms and stunning sunrises.*

Author: Elizabeth Earnshaw*
Quote: When people set boundaries with you, it’s their attempt to continue the relationship with you. It’s not an attempt to hurt you.*

Author: Swedish Proverb*
Quote: Shared joy is a double joy; shared sorrow is half a sorrow.*

Author: Madelaine Petsch*
Quote: The people who are bullying you, they're insecure about who they are, and that's why they're bullying you. It never has to do with the person they're bullying. They desperately want to be loved and be accepted, and they go out of their way to make people feel unaccepted so that they're not alone.*

Author: Carl Jung*
Quote: Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better to take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: I’m not sure that happiness is the ultimate goal.While single feeling existence is a falsehood, if I were to choose one state it would be contentment. For me, contentment is happiness with a touch of wisdom. The wisdom gained from allowing all feelings their place.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Stigma evokes shame, shame deepens secrets and secrets feed shame. Our culture needs to break that cycle. It’s not ok to have a mental illness or feel emotionally challenged. It hurts and it is scary. It is, however, normal.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Your feelings are natural, valid and essential to your operation as a healthy human being. Not allowing yourself the full range of your feelings will give you a greater chance of suffering mental health challenges.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: We have six core feelings and only one of them is happiness. It is no wonder that we can feel outnumbered and overwhelmed sometimes.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Just because you ignore or suppress a negative feeling it does not go away. Eventually it returns, when least welcome, with double the power.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: We understand that happiness is not a permanent state. It comes and goes. Yet, we do not take the same view of hurt, sadness and fear. We push them away and in doing so increase their power, their intensity and their longevity. Sit with your feelings they are there for a reason.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: My sadness, hurt, shame and fear, my anger and my happiness, are all signals that help me understand life. They describe my experiences, they don’t define me. The same can be true for you. *

Author: Nelson Mandela*
Quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.*

Author: Wayne Dyer*
Quote: Remember that any time you're filled with resentment, you're turning the controls of your emotional life over to others to manipulate.*

Author: Omar Suleiman*
Quote: A sign of a beautiful person is that they always see the beauty in others.*

Author: Ashley Hodgeson*
Quote: The strongest people aren't always the people that win, but the people that don’t give up when they lose.*

Author: Michael Jordan*
Quote: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.*

Author: Byron Katie*
Quote: As long as you think that the cause of your problem is “out there” – as long as you think that anyone or anything is responsible for your suffering – the situation is hopeless. It means that you are forever in the role of victim, that you’re suffering in paradise.*

Author: John Seely Brown*
Quote: The harder you fight to hold onto specific assumptions, the more likely there’s gold in letting go of them.*

Author: Dalai Lama*
Quote: Happiness mainly comes from our own attitude, rather than from external factors.*

Author: Buddha*
Quote: In our lives change is unavoidable, loss is unavoidable. In the adaptability and ease with which we experience change lies our happiness and freedom*

Author: Shannon Kaiser*
Quote: Ditch the expectations and let go of how your life is meant to turn out and you will be free. Life is supposed to flow and be natural.*

Author: Deepak Chopra*
Quote: People are doing the best they can from their own level of consciousness.*

Author: Robert Brault*
Quote: There are exactly as many special occasions in life as we choose to celebrate.*

Author: Rudyard Kipling*
Quote: I always prefer to believe the best of everybody; it saves so much trouble.*

Author: Roy Bennett*
Quote: More smiling, less worrying. More compassion, less judgement. More blessed, less stressed. More love, less hate.*

Author: Ziad K. Abdelnour*
Quote: Life is like photography. You need the negatives to develop.*

Author: Dave Willis*
Quote: One of the truest signs of maturity is the ability to disagree with someone while still remaining respectful.*

Author: Krister Stendahl*
Quote: Our vision is more obstructed by what we think we know than by our lack of knowledge.*

Author: Byron Katie*
Quote: Peace doesn’t require two people; it requires only one. It has to be you. The problem begins and ends there.*

Author: George Bernard Shaw*
Quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honourable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.*

Author: John Wooden*
Quote: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.*

Author: Charles R. Swindoll*
Quote: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.*

Author: Carl Rogers*
Quote: The good life is a process, not a state of being. It is a direction, not a destination.*

Author: Kallam Anji Reddy*
Quote: Everyone has a purpose in life and a unique talent to give to others. And when we blend this unique talent with service to others, we experience the ecstasy and exultation of our own spirit, which is the ultimate goal of all goals.*

Author: Simon Sinek*
Quote: I find, when you're an optimist, life has a funny way of looking after you.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: We are our most important influencer. We create the filters we see life through every day, we determine our responses to events and dictate the quality of our relationship with the world. Improve your self-talk.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: It never ceases to amaze me the improvement in my quality of relationships when I make a choice to view others behaviours positively.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: I can make my relationship with negativity too complex. In the end it is simple. They are thoughts. Only thoughts.  Just because I am the one who thinks them, that does not make them true. I don’t have to engage with my own negativity.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: True kindness springs from empathy and the understanding that we all struggle. Sometimes the kindest thing I can do for you, however, is to hand you back the gift of responsibility and accountability where, within that place of struggle, you will grow.*

Author: Mahatma Gandhi*
Quote: A man is but a product of his thoughts. What he thinks he becomes.*

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt*
Quote: You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude.*

Author: Carl Jung*
Quote: Show me a sane man and I will cure him for you.*

Author: Byron Katie*
Quote: A mind that doesn't question its judgements, makes the world very small and dangerous.*

Author: Wayne Dyer*
Quote: The law of flying was not discovered by the contemplation of things staying on the ground.*

Author: Eckhart Tolle*
Quote: When you complain, you make yourself a victim. Leave the situation, change the situation or accept it, all else is madness.*

Author: Rhonda Byrne*
Quote: You are free to think thoughts of worry or joy, and whatever you choose will attract the same kind back to you. Worry attracts worry. Joy attracts joy.*

Author: Tibetan Proverb*
Quote: The secret to living well and longer is: eat half, walk double, laugh triple and love without measure.*

Author: Maya Angelou*
Quote: Do the best you can until you know better. Then when you know better, do better.*

Author: Dan Gilbert*
Quote: Human beings are works in progress that mistakenly think they’re finished.*

Author: Lao Tzu*
Quote: Silence is a source of great strength.*

Author: Ritu Ghatourey*
Quote: People are not as beautiful as they look and talk. They are only as beautiful as they love, as they care, as they share.*

Author: Simon Sinek*
Quote: There is a difference between listening and waiting for your turn to speak.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: DON’T JUST DO SOMETHING...STAND THERE!! Leaping into action is not always the best thing you can do. Often simply giving time, attention and listening to the other person is what they really need.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: The only person who can take full responsibility for your emotional wellbeing is you. What will you do for yourself today?*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: Managing your food appropriately, both quality, quantity and timing can have a meaningful impact upon both your physical and your emotional energy levels. We are our own ecosystem.*

Author: Nelson Mandela*
Quote: Do not judge me by my successes, judge me by how many times I fell down and got back up again.*

Author: Byron Katie*
Quote: When you discover that all happiness is inside you, the wanting and needing are over, and life gets very exciting.*

Author: Wayne Dyer*
Quote: Every thought you have affects everything in your body.*

Author: Eckhart Tolle*
Quote: Be aware of your breathing. Notice how this takes attention away from your thinking and creates space.*

Author: Louise Hay*
Quote: If we are willing to do the mental work, almost anything can be healed.*

Author: Maya Angelou*
Quote: Courage is the most important of all the virtues because without courage, you can't practice any other virtue consistently.*

Author: Bonnie Prudden*
Quote: The best way to offset tension is with physical activity.*

Author: John F. Kennedy*
Quote: Intelligence and skill can only function at the peak of their capacity. when the body is healthy and strong.*

Author: Hippocrates*
Quote: Walking is man's best medicine*

Author: Hippocrates*
Quote: Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food*

Author: Jack LaLanne*
Quote: Nutrition is King, Exercise is Queen, put them together and you have a Kingdom.*

Author: Ellie Krieger*
Quote: A balanced life is like a three legged stool. Each leg - nutrition, fitness and wellness- is necessary and supports the other.*

Author: Carl Rogers*
Quote: People are just as wonderful as sunsets if you let them be. When I look at a sunset, I don't find myself saying, "Soften the orange a bit on the right hand corner." I don't try to control a sunset. I watch with awe as it unfolds.*

Author: Sigmund Freud*
Quote: Out of your vulnerabilities will come your strength.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: A journal listens to you like almost no one else can listen...unconditionally and non-judgmentally. Make journaling part of your emotional health maintenance.*

Author: Vienna Pharaon*
Quote: Avoiding your triggers isn’t healing. Healing happens when you’re triggered and you’re able to move through the pain, the pattern, and the story, and walk away to a different ending.*

Author: Lester Levinson*
Quote: We can have peace if we let go of wanting to change the past and wanting to control the future.*

Author: Iain Thomas*
Quote: Be soft. Do not let the world make you hard. Do not let pain make you hate. Do not let the bitterness steal your sweetness.*

Author: Don Miguel Ruiz*
Quote: Letting go of the past means that you can enjoy the dream that is happening right now.*

Author: Marianne Williamson*
Quote: Forgiveness is the choice to see people as they are now. When we’re mad at people, we’re angry because of something they said or did before this moment. By letting go of the past, we make room for miracles to replace our grievances.*

Author: Marianne Williamson*
Quote: Forgiveness is not always easy. At times, it feels more painful than the wound we suffered to forgive the one that inflicted it. And yet, there is no peace without forgiveness.*

Author: Lewis B. Smedes*
Quote: You will know that forgiveness has begun when you recall those that hurt you and feel the power to wish them well.*

Author: Najwa Zebian*
Quote: Never wish them pain. That’s not who you are. If they caused you pain, they must have pain inside. Wish them healing. That’s what they need.*

Author: Jennie Young*
Quote: Pause and remember: If you empty yourself of yesterday’s sorrows, you will have much more room for today’s joy.*

Author: Karen Salmansohn*
Quote: Sometimes you just need to talk about something - not to get sympathy or help, but just to kill its power by allowing the truth of things to hit the air.*

Author: Catherine Ponder*
Quote: When you hold resentment towards another, you are bound to that person or condition by an emotional link that is stronger than steel. Forgiveness is the only way to dissolve that link and get free.*

Author: Carl Bard*
Quote: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.*

Author: Trent Shelton*
Quote: Sometimes the only closure you need is the understanding that you deserve better.*

Author: Marianne Williamson*
Quote: We do not heal the past by dwelling there; we heal the past by living fully in the present.*

Author: Steve Maraboli*
Quote: Why let go of yesterday? Because yesterday has already let go of you.*

Author: Buddha*
Quote: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace*

Author: Josh Shipp*
Quote: You either get bitter or you get better. You either take what has been dealt to you and allow it to make you a better person or you allow it to tear you down. The choice does not belong to fate, it belongs to you.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: We often mix up forgiveness with something we do for another. It is, ultimately, an act of kindness to ourselves.*

Author: Julian Hall*
Quote: It seems to me that a disposition to hold on to resentment is actually a form of self harm. Not letting go of a grudge doesn’t hurt them, but you can remember the pain time and time again.*

Author: Mahatma Gandhi*
Quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.*

Author: Carl Jung*
Quote: Nothing has a stronger influence psychologically on their environment and especially on their children than the unlived life of the parent.*

Author: Carl Jung*
Quote: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.*

Author: Eckhart Tolle*
Quote: You cannot find yourself by going into the past. You can find yourself by coming into the present.*
